reporting-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Lithuania

title.narrative: Technical assistance to the Customs of Georgia in the customs valuation and verification field

description.narrative: One of the priority targets of the Presidency of the Republic of Lithuania to the European Council in 2013 (Resolution No. XI-1651 of the Lithuanian Parliament adopted on 10 November 2011) – Eastern Partnership countries converging with the European Union in implementing reforms and concluding planned agreements with the European Union. Cooperation and mutual assistance between the Georgian and Lithuanian Customs will contribute to the continuous movement of goods and safe international trade. The assistance to the Georgian customs officers in the customs valuation field will enable customs administrations to effectively manage risk and improve checks performed in the international trade supply chain. During the project, knowledge, required for administrative functions, organizing, planning and carrying out checks to ensure the correct application of customs legislation both during and after the customs clearance of procedures, will be presented to the customs specialists of Georgia, with particular emphasis on practical training for officers.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Lithuania
